pr_title: Add a utility class for parsing GeoJson

timeline.message:
Update Tile model

I've added four fields to the tile model:

- URL: A valid url that store the tile's corresponding imagery.
- X: X coordinate of the tile.
- Y: Y coordinate of the tile.
- Z: Z coordinate of the tile.

This change also includes necessary changes to the TileEntity and File
download worker that result from the model changes listed above. I've
also updated some doc comments to make them more consistent with other
comments throughout the codebase.

Add a GeoJsonParser utility class

This class handles translating GeoJson to and from the model entities
we're interested in--at the moment, just tiles. It also implements a
method to get all the tiles specified in a GeoJson that intersect with a
particular bounds (we'll use this to download tiles based on offline
imagery selections).
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/google/ground-android into json-parser

replies.bodyText:
isPolygon expects a geometry object, but here we return the entire feature object (and we need to maintain it down stream).
I should move these checks into the GeoJsonTile.fromJson method anyway.
replies.author: scolsen

timeline.bodyText: Would getFilenameFromCoords() be more appropriate?
timeline.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText: I like filenameFromCoords --but I'm dropping get because this method is static (though maybe it shouldn't be static)!
replies.author: scolsen

timeline.bodyText: Nit: maybe -> Maybe
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText: What if the tile has been deleted since this job was queued? Maybe we shouldn't fail but just exit?
timeline.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText:
Hmm, it seems like the right solution here is to use the workManager to cancel the jobs as soon as the tile is deleted: https://developer.android.com/topic/libraries/architecture/workmanager/how-to/cancel-stop-work. Probably some listener on the DB that fires off cancelAllWork when a user deletes an area and all its corresponding tiles are up for deletion. i.e. whatever method we implement that deletes tiles first checks in w/ the manager to see if any work is queued and stops all the relevant work first. -- we'll probably have to tag jobs by area id to ensure we stop work for just that area (and not e.g. other areas that were queued up immediately after)
I think this would appropriately handle that case, while this check explicitly uncovers whether or not we queued this without adding something to the DB first.
replies.author: scolsen

replies.bodyText: I don't feel smart enough to consider all the interactions between the workers and managers, so as a defensive maneuver would normally try to make everything idempotent that can be. Besides the user deleting the tile, it could also get remove if the user clears the app cache; I'm not sure if workers get cancelled as well when that happens. Even if they do, it would be nice not to need to know whether that's the case. Perhaps we can just bail out and log a debug log message instead?
replies.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText: That sounds fair to me--so, I suppose we need to move this nullness check into the manager and avoid scheduling any work in the first place if we can't find the tile in the DB.
replies.author: scolsen

replies.bodyText: We will need the nullness check here regardless, since this logic is executed in a different scheduler than the thread that queues the tile. Currently the manager will only queue work after adding the tiles anyway iirc?
replies.author: gino-m

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' into json-parser

Refactor JSON geometry methods, return the immutable list of tiles

This change moves two checks for appropriate geojson features into the
GeoJsonTile class, and refactors the tile constructor into several
supporting methods.

Any fields that are requried to specify a tile throw exceptions on their
absence--this way we can debug and diagnose issues in the JSON itself,
as well as potentially inform users of issues in their own JSON later.

We also now actually return the list of constructed tiles form the
parser.
Merge branch 'json-parser' of https://github.com/scolsen/ground-android into json-parser
Fix typo, maybe -> Maybe
Rename pathFromCoords -> filenameFromCoords in Tile

timeline.bodyText:
Java auto converts int when using + with Strings, e.g:
String filename = z + "-" + x + "-" y;
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText: => getTileUrl(..)?
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText: Please move field names into String constants.
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText: Since you're throwing a checked exception, the caller will need to handle it, in which case the catch() and Log statements aren't needed here.
timeline.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText:
My thinking was to particularize the point of failure by catching and logging in the helper methods + the caller.
So for instance, if we failed to get coordinates, we'd have a log + stack trace of roughly:
GeoJsonParser: Failed to parse geojson
GeoJsonParser: couldn't parse json tile coordinates
In which case we have more info to work with to debug -- wdyt? Is that overkill? Is it better to define a custom exception instead to differentiate and throw those? --that way we can still be specific about the cause of failure and only need to catch in the caller
replies.author: scolsen

timeline.bodyText:
A few suggestions on code structure:

 This deals with deserializing JSON files, so it probably in the persistence package. (e.g. ...persistence.geojson?)
 Rather than pass JSONObject around to static methods, can we wrap the different instances in typed accessor objects? (e.g., JsonGeometry, JsonTileExtent, etc)? (https://testing.googleblog.com/2017/11/obsessed-with-primitives.html)
 If this file is  moved to its own package, the inner classes and be promoted to outer classes in their own file to help readability.
 GeoJsonParser can then provide a custom GeoJson object with the data we're interested in.

Wdyt?
timeline.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText: SG! After the initial impl, this component seems complex enough to me to up-level it to its own package, which will make it easier to define accessor objects like you suggest--plus it'll make it easier to extend in the future.
replies.author: scolsen

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' into json-parser

Refactor geo json parsing utility

This commit refactors our approach to geo JSON parsing, including:

- Moving the parser into its own package under persistance
- Creating classes to represent each peice of JSON data we need
- Using constants to refer to JSON key names
- Healthy use of optionals to avoid non-catastrophic exceptions
- Simplifying the parser class itself

I've also replaced the cartesian coordinates based path conversion in
Tiles with the original id based-approach, since it's simpler for the
time being.
Merge branch 'json-parser' of https://github.com/scolsen/ground-android into json-parser
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/google/ground-android into json-parser

timeline.bodyText: Consider using List instead. Also, an empty list is synonymous with Optional.empty(), so Optional isn't needed here.

timeline.bodyText: this is only needed in the constructor to disambiguate the field name from the constructor arg, please remove throughout.
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText: get() with throw an exception if the Optional is empty. We should either check .isPresent() first, use functional methods to propagate the empty state, or avoid the Optional altogether.
timeline.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText: sg, for the first commit addressing these comments I'm going to stick with the optional and just add a check for empties--I think your suggestion to remove the optional entirely makes sense in this case though, so in subsequent commits I may do that.
replies.author: scolsen

timeline.bodyText: Same comment here - let's get these states on the fly rather than caching them since it adds carrying cost without adding performance [possible overoptimization].
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText: Please make these classes package private (i.e. class GeoJsonGeometry) to avoid accidental usage outside this package and to signal they're tightly coupled to the parser.
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText: Can we split the loading of the file into a String into a separate method so that this method will focus on  parsing its contents?
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.message:
Improve code quality of GeoJsonExtents

Including:

- Use an ImmutableList instead of an Array to represent vertices
- Rename instances of coordinates to vertices
- Calculate vertices on demand instead of allocating
- Check that optionals aren't empty before calling `get()`
- Reorder LatLngs in vertices list
- Make various methods/classes package private

Improve code quality in GeoJsonGeometry

Notably:

- Make the class package private
- Calculate JSON field values on demand, instead of allocating

Improve code quality in GeoJsonParser

- Move static methods below public ones
- Split JSON file reading into a separate function
- Read files character by character instead of line by line
- Return empty strings when URL and ID fields aren't present in JSON
  tiles.
Compute GeoJsonTile values on demand instead of caching

timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText: Ideally we wouldn't keep Tile in an invalidate state if the file is invalid. Could you add a TODO here to throw an Exception instead that gets handled downstream?

timeline.bodyText: This will return Optional.of("") if it doesn't exists. We should either model missing as null, Optional.empty(), or "". Any of those alternatives are fine, but all these will make edge cases harder to catch.

replies.bodyText: Gotcha, returning Optional.empty on...well, empty values.
replies.author: scolsen

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/google/ground-android into json-parser

Remove redundant getter method in GeoJsonExtent

getPolygonVertices and getVertices were redundant--this change renames
the PolygonVertices method to getVertices and exposes it to callers
directly (package-private).

Improve code quality in GeoJsonParser

- Be terse; merge equivalent lines.
- Throw exceptions where it makes sense.
- Add a TODO to throw further exceptions later.

Remove cartesian coordinates from Tile model/db entity

YAGNI/KISS--we don't have reason to store these yet, and accessing tiles
by path/id alone was sufficient in the past. We can revisit storing
these values if we need to in the future.
Return Optional.empty on empty ID values in JSONTile

timeline.bodyText: If you're throwing the exception callers will need to catch it, and they will try to log it as well; in that case no need for the try/catch and Log,
timeline.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText: In fact I see it's logged in the calling function, so ok to remove the try/catch block.
replies.author: gino-m

timeline.bodyText: This error message is slightly misleading "Ignoring Error in JSON" might be more accurate.
timeline.author: gino-m

replies.bodyText: Good call, updated to "Ignoring error in JSON array"
replies.author: scolsen

timeline.bodyText: When an exception is thrown here result[i] will remain uninitialized (null). In this case you'd need to filter them out in the caller intersectingTiles(). A cleaner/simpler approach would be to add them to an ArrayList instead of a primitive array.
timeline.author: gino-m

timeline.message:
Use ArrayList instead of Array to avoid nulls

Prior to this, malformed JSON objects encountered by the toArray method
would result in nasty nulls. We now use ArrayList to avoid breaking our
stream over these values later.

I also removed an extraneous try/catch.
Merge branch 'master' into json-parser

Address PMD issues

- Use List interface instead of ArrayList directly.
- Remove unused import.
